verse.name: v1
verse.lines: 'Twas of a maid both young and fair, Whilst walking out for to take the air. She met a sailor all on her way, And I paid attention, and I paid attention, To hear what they might say.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: He says, "Fair maid, why roam alone? For the day's far spent, and the night's coming on." While crystal tears from her eyes did flow: "It's my dark-eyed sailor, oh, my dark eyed sailor, That proved my overthrow."

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: "'Tis three long years since he left this land. A new gold ring he took off his hand. He broke this token, gave half to me, While the other half's lying, the other half's lying At the bottom of the sea."

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: "Oh,"he says, "Fair maid, drive him off your mind, For as good a sailor as him you'll find! Love turns aside, and cold does grow Like a winter's morning, like a winter's morning, When the hills are cover'd with snow."

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: "His coal-black eyes and curly hair, His flatt'ring tongue did my heart ensnare. Genteel he was, no rake lie you, To advise a maiden, to advise a maiden To slight the jacket blue!'

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: "A tarry sailor I'll ne'er disdain, Always true till he comes again. So drink his health; here's a piece of coin. But my dark eyed sailor, but my dark eyed sailor Still claims this heart of mine."

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: When William did the ring unfold She seem'd distracted midst joy and woe. "You're welcome, William; I have lands and gold For my dark eyed sailor, for my dark eyed sailor, So manly, true and bold!"

verse.name: v8
verse.lines: Down in a cottage by a riverside, In peace and harmony they now reside. So, girls, prove true whilst your lover's away. Oft a cloudy morning, oft a cloudy morning Brings forth a pleasant day.
